intro: Varronia martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique varronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Varronia martinicensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some parts of the Caribbean.
